snippet: A federal court should require the Obama administration to carry out a 2008 law that requires rearview technology in new cars.
abstract: Editorial criticizes Obama administration for virtually paralyzing implementation of 2008 law that gave the Transportation Dept until Feb 2011 to issue a rule requiring automakers to include rearview technology in new cars; supports suit filed by safety advocates that asks a federal court to order the department to issue a final rule within 90 days.
lead_paragraph: A federal court should require the Obama administration to carry out a 2008 law that requires rearview technology in new cars.

headline.main: A Blind Spot on Rearview Cameras
